newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina seen postponing diesel cars tax hike.
newsitem.headline: Argentina seen postponing diesel cars tax hike.

text.p: The Argentine government is considering postponing plans to introduce a new 10 percent tax on new diesel cars to April 1 from January 1, Horacio Losoviz, head of the industry association ADEFA, said Monday.
Losoviz told reporters that he was informed of the possible change by Economy Minister Roque Fernandez at a meeting they held earlier in the day.
The 10 percent tax hike was announced in August as part of an austerity package launched by Fernandez in an effort to bridge the budget deficit this year and next.
